title: Tsayuwa Kan Gaskiya da Ƙarfin Zuciya: Hanyar Samun Babban Matsayi a Rayuwar Ɗan Adam
author: Unknown

paragraphs.translationL1: Human life is a testing ground filled with emotional turmoil and heavy tasks; Great Success cannot be achieved through incitement or frivolity, because it must be pursued through Perseverance, Frugality, and the creation of a Strong Heart (Mental Toughness), which has a spiritual strength that endures the heat and cold of the world without breaking. This article will provide a deep map on the foundation of success in the field of Interaction and Endurance, while examining how Life Leaders with Strong Hearts faced the world's struggles until they reached a place of honor, where we will confirm that Greatness comes from within, not from the outside world.

Strength of Self-Thought (Steadfastness of Heart) and the Foundation of Life. Strength of Self-Thought — which we will call 'Steadfastness of Heart' or 'Inner Resilience' — is the pillar that holds the great building of life, because a person cannot achieve their High Aspirations if the core of their thought has not reached the level of tough skin that does not break with the small strike of a trial. This Steadfastness of Heart does not mean a lack of feeling or compassion; rather, it means reducing worry and facing problems head-on without completely surrendering to despair, which shows that everyone controls their own mental state in the storm of life. For example, people like David Goggins have excelled in the world's toughest tests, showing that Pain and Adversity are not obstacles to progress, but are the fuel for the human heart, where he emphasizes that we must accept pain as a tool for improvement that helps us strengthen the bone of perseverance. If something contradicts you or puts you in trouble, you must stop engaging in self-pity; instead, use that heart to bring out great perseverance from within you, so you do not let the pain coming from outside enter your spirit and kill your fire which is burning purely on your path to seeking a great position.

Setting an Iron Rule for Yourself and Managing Daily Activities. True mental toughness requires a person to live with a strict Iron Discipline that does not forgive or play, because being strong-hearted starts by managing daily activities that are not related to desire or showing off to others. This simple system includes waking up early before the day begins its work, not just to have more time, but to show yourself that you are the master of your life over the comfort of sleep and laziness which brings despair to anyone seeking progress in life. Furthermore, you must complete what is started, because every small task you begin, you must persevere until you finish it completely without play or delay, as this supports your thought that you are a person of character who does not allow play on the promise taken to carry out work until the end. This core of work is what creates a confident heart that prepares a person for great tasks that cannot be achieved with a weak spirit or a love of rest.
